resources.string:
"Quick Guide:

Step 1 – Enable ADB Debugging
In order for the Fire TV to accept sideloaded apps, you must enable ADB Debugging. You may turn it back off once you’re done sideloading apps.
From the home screen, scroll down to “Settings”
Scroll right to “SYSTEM”
Scroll down to “Developer Options”
Change “ADB debugging” to “ON”
Change ”Unknown Sources” to ”ON”

Step 2 – Obtain your Fire TV’s IP Address
From the home screen, scroll down to “Settings”
Scroll right to “SYSTEM”
Select “About”
Scroll down to “Network”
Write down the numbers next to “IP Address”

Beta Version with a known bug: if you write wrong ip adress (xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx, no spaces, input with “.”) app will hang, also sometimes after transfering all apps too. if all apps installed on your firetv you may safely force-close the app from your phone's settings menu. will be fixed in next releases.
 Last but not least: thanks for trying/using our app. We are happy for emails and market comments. Thank you! - Progress Information for the Notificationsystem: 0 start, 1 connected, 2 prepared packages, 3 installing first app, 4 installing next app,..., 100 finished"

1.) Input FireTV IP Address in Settings. 
2.) Select Apps from List below 
3.) Press "->FireTV" Button 
5.) Wait (minimize with home button)
6.) Donate, if you want!
Templates define how lists will be formated. You can create as many as you like, but you must have at least one.

A template consists of the list item (to be filled with app info), as well as an optional header and footer. All parts will be concatenated \"as-is\", with the item being repeated once per app. Supply newlines as needed. Header, item and footer may contain variables.
Hi,\nseems like you find this app useful. Would you consider rating it? This will only take a minute of your time, but encourages further development.
Item format, may not be blank
Yikes! How did you manage to delete all your templates?!
Select the apps you want to list!
Whoops! Your list was too large for sharing. Copied to clipboard instead.

Annotations can be referenced in templates as ${comment} and may themselves contain other variables (${packagename}, ${displayname}, ${source}, ${uid}, ${version}, ${versioncode}, ${firstinstalled}, ${lastupdated}, ${datadir}, $targetsdk}, ${tags} and ${marketid}). Annotations are kept when their app is deinstalled in case it gets reinstalled later. Tags allow for grouping apps for faster selection.
No apps tagged! Apps can be tagged via the \'Annotations\' screen.
